bug.author: Trevor-zhang
bug.summary: Failed deploy Alluxio on a Cluster with HA
bug.description: Alluxio Version: What version of Alluxio are you using? V2.3.0 Describe the bug A clear and concise description of what the bug is. Alluxio has some problems when starting ha based on raft election To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior (as minimally and precisely as possible) Expected behavior A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. Urgency Describe the impact and urgency of the bug. Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Trevor-zhang>@Trevor-zhang</denchmark-link> as far as I can see, you did not specify how to find the master in the configuration for node . In order to find the master/masters, it must have one of the following, as the error in worker log says: <denchmark-code>2020-09-22 xx:47:25,033 ERROR AlluxioWorker - Fatal error: Cannot run Alluxio worker; Unable to determine master address. Please modify alluxio-site.properties to either set alluxio.master.hostname, configure zookeeper with alluxio.zookeeper.enabled=true and alluxio.zookeeper.address=[comma-separated zookeeper master addresses], or utilize internal HA by setting alluxio.master.embedded.journal.addresses=[comma-separated alluxio master addresses] </denchmark-code>
You are using embedded journal for HA, so you must configure alluxio.master.embedded.journal.addresses to be the same as on the master nodes. The worker will try each address defined in this property, until it finds a serving master. And that is how the worker reaches the master.

I think you can debug configuration errors by running one of the following: <denchmark-code># Runs a set of validations on each of the nodes, including configuration $ bin/alluxio validateEnv all
# Runs a set of validations on each of the nodes, including configuration $ bin/alluxio validateEnv local
# Run locally and only checking the conf $ bin/alluxio validateConf </denchmark-code>

Adding the solution so it might help other users too. 2 masters in HA failed to be started by alluxio-start.sh all, the error is in the console output as well as the task.log: <denchmark-code>Executing the following command on all master nodes and logging to /data/alluxio/logs/task.log: /data/alluxio/bin/alluxio-start.sh -a master Waiting for tasks to finish... Task on 'xx-dev-cq-ecs-dtpbu-datalake-cdh-work-01' fails, exit code: 255 Task on 'xx-dev-cq-ecs-dtpbu-datalake-cdh-work-02' fails, exit code: 255 </denchmark-code>
The issue was the other nodes don't have passwordless SSH access so the script on one node is not able to start the processes on other nodes. Fixed by enabling passwordless SSH. Alternatively users can also manually start the process locally on each node.

The issue was the other nodes don't have passwordless SSH access so the script on one node is not able to start the processes on other nodes. Fixed by enabling passwordless SSH. Alternatively users can also manually start the process locally on each node.
yep. I found that if you have multiple masters, then each master must do SSH to other masters. Because even if you just start the local master, the master will also access other master nodes through SSH.
